backtesting_server.main

Module for uploading backtesting results to MySQL server.

Created on Tuesday 19th March 2024. @author: Harry New

Module Contents

class backtesting_server.main.BacktestingServer(standard_details: dict, sql_details: dict)[source]

Object representing the SQL server, allowing users to interact without having to directly connect. - Handles backtesting strategies. - Allows results to be uploaded.

connect(database: str) → tuple[paramiko.Channel, pymysql.cursors.Cursor] | tuple[None, None][source]

Connecting to MySQL server using SSH.

Parameters:

database (str) – Name of database to connect to.

Returns:

  • paramiko.Channel – Channel to MySQL server.

  • pymysql.cursors.Cursor – Cursor to execute SQL queries.

upload_instrument(instrument: ig_package.Instrument, live_tracking: bool = False, dataset: pandas.DataFrame = [], groups: list[InstrumentGroup] = []) → None[source]

Uploading instrument to the backtesting server.

Parameters:

  • instrument (ig_package.Instrument) – Instrument the historical data corresponds to.

  • live_tracking (bool = False) – OPTIONAL Enable/disable live tracking of instrument.

  • dataset (pd.DataFrame = []) – OPTIONAL DataFrame containing the data to be uploaded.

  • groups (list[InstrumentGroup] = []) – OPTIONAL List of Instrument Groups to add the instrument to.

update_historical_data(ig: ig_package.IG, groups: list[InstrumentGroup] = []) → None[source]

Updating new historical data on instruments being tracked with the BacktestingServer.

Parameters:

  • ig (ig_package.IG) – IG object to interact with IG Group’s API.

  • groups (list[InstrumentGroup] = []) – OPTIONAL List of Instrument Groups to update.

_check_historical_data_summary_exists() → bool[source]

Checking if the historical data summary table exists on the MySQL server. Handles this by requesting entire table and checking for response.

Returns:

Depending on whether the summary table exists or not.

Return type:

bool

_check_instrument_in_historical_data(instrument: ig_package.Instrument) → bool[source]

Checking if instrument is already in historical data.

Parameters:

instrument (ig_package.Instrument) – Instrument to be checked.

Returns:

Boolean depending if instrument is present in historical data.

Return type:

bool

_create_historical_data_summary() → None[source]

Creating the historical data summary on the MySQL server.

_add_historical_data_summary(instrument: ig_package.Instrument, live_tracking: bool = False, groups: list[InstrumentGroup] = []) → None[source]

Adding instrument to the historical data summary and creating new table for historical data.

Parameters:

  • instrument (ig_package.Instrument) – Instrument to add to the historical data summary.

  • live_tracking (bool) – OPTIONAL Enable/disable live tracking of instrument.

  • groups (list[InstrumentGroups]) – OPTIONAL List of Instrument Groups.

_upload_clean_historical_data(instrument: ig_package.Instrument) → None[source]

Uploading historical data for an instrument with no previous data.

Parameters:

instrument (ig_package.Instrument) – Instrument to upload data for.

_upload_on_existing_historical_data(instrument: ig_package.Instrument, previous_datetime: datetime.datetime) → None[source]

Uploading up-to-date historical data on instrument already with existing historical data.

Parameters:

  • instrument (ig_package.Instrument) – Instrument for uploading recent historical data on.

  • previous_datetime (datetime) – Datetime of last historical price.

_create_instrument_groups_table() → None[source]

Creating instrument groups table on the database.

Checking if instrument groups tables exists within the database.

Boolean if instrument groups table exists or not.

bool

_update_groups_in_historical_data() → None[source]

Updating the Historical Data Summary for any new Instrument Groups that have been added.

upload_live_data(ig: ig_package.IG, instrument_list: list[ig_package.Instrument] = [], instrument_group: InstrumentGroup = None, capture_period: int = None) → None[source]

Uploading live data continuously for all instruments provided.

Parameters:

  • ig (ig_package.IG) – IG object.

  • instrument_list (list[ig_package.Instrument] = []) – OPTIONAL List of instruments to cycle through collecting live data and uploading to the server.

  • instrument_group (InstrumentGroup = None) – OPTIONAL Instrument group defined on the Backtesting Server to cycle through.

  • capture_period (int = 0) – OPTIONAL Capturing data for a certain amount of time.

class backtesting_server.main.InstrumentGroup(name: str, cursor: pymysql.cursors.Cursor)[source]

Class for representing a group of instruments on the Backtesting Server. These instruments can have entire actions performed on them, allowing for easy management of specific instruments.
